<title level="1" right="Rules">[Property Runes](/Rules.aspx?ID=3168)</title>

**Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 225 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">
<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">
Property runes add special abilities to armor or a weapon in addition to the item's fundamental runes. If a suit of armor or a weapon has multiple etchings of the same rune, only the highest-level one applies. You can upgrade a property rune to a higher-level type of that rune in the same way you would upgrade a fundamental rune.

Rune abilities that must be activated follow the rules for [activating magic items](/Rules.aspx?ID=3139).
</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="">Specific Armor, Weapons, and Shields</title>

Specific Armor, Weapons, and Shields ”Unlike armor, weapons, and shields enhanced with runes, specific armor, weapons, and shields (such as [moonlit chain](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2809), a [bloodletting kukri](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2862), or a [lion's shield](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2823)) are created for a specific purpose and can work quite differently from other items of their type. These items can’t gain property runes, but you can add or improve their fundamental runes.
</aside>
